security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate content processing skill with no malicious intent. Static scanner flagged 177 issues but most are false positives from pattern misidentification. The skill reads local Markdown files, fetches article content from user-specified URLs, calls Anthropic API for content generation, and writes output files. All operations follow expected workflow patterns with no data exfiltration, no command injection risks, and no credential misuse.

content.user_title: Process article lists into viral posts
content.value_statement: You have a list of article links but no time to read and rewrite each one. This skill automatically fetches article content and generates viral posts using a proven content framework.
actual_capabilities: Parse Markdown files containing article links in standard [Title](URL) format
Fetch full article content from URLs using readability extraction
Generate viral posts using Defou x Stanley content framework
Automatically trigger verification and optimization after generation
Archive processed input files and save outputs organized by date
Watch input directory for new files and process automatically
limitations: Requires valid Anthropic API key to generate content
Cannot process paywalled or blocked article content
Limited to 15,000 characters per article due to context limits
Rate limited to 2 concurrent articles to avoid overloading sources

use_cases.title: Batch Content Repurposing
use_cases.description: Turn a list of 20 article links into 20 viral posts in one automated session.

use_cases.title: Weekly Digest Generation
use_cases.description: Convert collected article links into formatted content for your newsletter subscribers.

use_cases.title: Social Post Pipeline
use_cases.description: Build a pipeline to transform industry articles into platform-specific viral posts.

prompt_templates.title: Basic List Processing
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a markdown file in local_inputs/ with article links in [Title](URL) format, then run the article list processor.

prompt_templates.prompt: Edit the generateContent function prompts to customize the output style for your specific audience.

output_examples.input: Drop multiple markdown files into local_inputs/ directory
output: Processor watches for new files continuously
Each file processed with 2 concurrent workers

best_practices: Use clear, descriptive article titles in your markdown files for better generated content.
Test with a single article first to verify API configuration before batch processing.
Keep article lists under 50 links per file to maintain manageable processing times.
anti_patterns: Do not process articles from paywalled sites without permission.
Avoid processing extremely long articles that may exceed context limits.
Do not modify the input directory path while the watcher is running.

faq.question: What file formats are supported?
faq.answer: Only .md and .txt files in local_inputs/ are processed. Other files are ignored.

faq.question: How long does processing take?
faq.answer: Each article takes 30-60 seconds. With 2 concurrent workers, 10 articles take about 5 minutes.

faq.question: What happens to failed fetches?
faq.answer: Failed articles are skipped with an error log. The processor continues with remaining articles.

faq.question: Can I use this without an API key?
faq.answer: Set MOCK_MODE=true in .env to test without API calls. No content will be generated.

faq.question: Where are output files saved?
faq.answer: Generated posts are saved to outputs/defou-stanley-posts/ with timestamped filenames.

faq.question: How do I stop the watcher?
faq.answer: Press Ctrl+C in the terminal. Use npm run skill:list to restart anytime.
